headline.main: Obama Says Aid to Farmers Cuts Child Stunting Across Africa
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Aid to Farmers Cuts Child Stunting Across Africa

docs.snippet: U.S. President Barack Obama, wrapping up a visit to the continent of his father's birth, toured an Ethiopian factory making baby food on Tuesday to show how investment in farming can cut hunger and stunting....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Barack Obama, wrapping up a visit to the continent of his father's birth, toured an Ethiopian factory making baby food on Tuesday to show how investment in farming can cut hunger and stunting.

headline.main: BoE's Cunliffe Says No Turning Back the 'Regulatory Dial'
headline.print_headline: BoE's Cunliffe Says No Turning Back the 'Regulatory Dial'

docs.snippet: Banks must make painful adjustments to how they operate in a post-crisis world and not rely on policymakers turning back the overall "regulatory dial", Bank of England Deputy Governor Jon Cunliffe said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Banks must make painful adjustments to how they operate in a post-crisis world and not rely on policymakers turning back the overall "regulatory dial", Bank of England Deputy Governor Jon Cunliffe said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Is Stumped on Question of Keystone Pipeline

docs.snippet: The day after Hillary Rodham Clinton put forth a detailed plan for confronting climate change, she would not answer a question of whether or not she would support the Keystone XL Pipeline project....
docs.abstract: The day after Hillary Rodham Clinton put forth a detailed plan for confronting climate change, she would not answer a question of whether or not she would support the Keystone XL Pipeline project.

headline.main: United Nations Warns Turkey Against Calling Buffer a 'Safe Zone'
headline.print_headline: United Nations Warns Turkey Against Calling Buffer a 'Safe Zone'

docs.snippet: United Nations aid chief Stephen O'Brien warned Turkey on Tuesday against calling its planned buffer in northern Syria "a safe zone" unless there is a guarantee of protection for  civilians who are likely to flood the area for help....
docs.lead_paragraph: United Nations aid chief Stephen O'Brien warned Turkey on Tuesday against calling its planned buffer in northern Syria "a safe zone" unless there is a guarantee of protection for  civilians who are likely to flood the area for help.

headline.main: Georgia Man Sentenced to 15 Years for Trying to Help Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Georgia Man Sentenced to 15 Years for Trying to Help Islamic State

docs.snippet: A Georgia man was sentenced to 15 years in federal prison on Tuesday for attempting to support the Islamic State militant group that authorities said he had planned to join before being arrested in Atlanta in 2014, the U.S. Justice Department said...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Georgia man was sentenced to 15 years in federal prison on Tuesday for attempting to support the Islamic State militant group that authorities said he had planned to join before being arrested in Atlanta in 2014, the U.S. Justice Department said.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton on Keystone XL Pipeline

docs.snippet: During a campaign stop in New Hampshire on Tuesday, Hillary Rodham Clinton offered a vague answer to a town hall participant’s question on whether she supports the Keystone XL pipeline....
docs.lead_paragraph: During a campaign stop in New Hampshire on Tuesday, Hillary Rodham Clinton offered a vague answer to a town hall participant’s question on whether she supports the Keystone XL pipeline.

headline.main: Critically Endangered Northern White Rhino Dies at Czech Zoo
headline.print_headline: Critically Endangered Northern White Rhino Dies at Czech Zoo

docs.snippet: One of the last five northern white rhinoceros left in the world has died....

headline.main: Fugitive's Role in Horror Film Leads to His Arrest
headline.print_headline: Fugitive's Role in Horror Film Leads to His Arrest

docs.snippet: A fugitive has been arrested after federal agents saw his photo in a Washington state newspaper that ran a story about a low-budget horror movie....
docs.lead_paragraph: A fugitive has been arrested after federal agents saw his photo in a Washington state newspaper that ran a story about a low-budget horror movie.

headline.main: U.S. to Parole Convicted Israeli Spy Pollard on November 21
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Parole Convicted Israeli Spy Pollard on November 21

docs.snippet: Jonathan Pollard, a former U.S. Navy intelligence analyst convicted of spying for Israel, will be released on parole on November 21 after 30 years in prison, a federal parole board ruled on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jonathan Pollard, a former U.S. Navy intelligence analyst convicted of spying for Israel, will be released on parole on November 21 after 30 years in prison, a federal parole board ruled on Tuesday.
